intro: Tanacetum gnaphaloides, commonly known as golden marguerite, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray florets surrounding a central cluster of disk florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. It typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Tanacetum gnaphaloides is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
